group_1.textLeft: There they are!

group_1.textRight: After them!
Th-there's so many of them!

group_1.textLeft: We're completely surrounded…@At this rate…

group_1.textCenter: That strange power…@You two are Rakshasis, are you not?

group_1.textRight: Rakshasis?

group_1.textLeft: No, we're, ah…@How do you say…

group_1.textRight: W-we're a traveling troupe doing street@performances!

group_1.textLeft: (Good excuse… So then...)
Yes, here you go!@We have our repertoire of secrets and tricks.

group_1.textRight: What a fascinating sleight.
But how is it that you managed@to parry all of our attacks?

group_1.textLeft: W-well, that's…you could say it comes@with working hard every day…?
Like, it's a kind of street performance.

group_1.textRight: I don't know about that…@But more importantly…
Are you two able to understand our language?

group_1.textLeft: (If I'm not mistaken…@Nemu's powers must still be in effect?)
(In that case, Rabi must be somewhere@nearby…)

group_1.textRight: Seize these two girls, but do not kill them!

group_1.textLeft: (We were captured and taken along@with the Mongolian Army...)

group_1.textRight: Isn't it about time you decided to help us?
I'll provide whatever you desire as a reward.

group_1.textLeft: But...you want us to fight those nuns...?

group_1.textRight: That's right. The evil arts should be@fought in kind.
You see…the last time we targeted the nunnery@to the north of here, we had some difficulties.

group_1.textLeft: From the sound of it, by "target"@you mean you're attacking them!

group_1.textRight: Of course.@That's what this war is all about.

group_1.textLeft: Wh-what the heck is going on here?

group_1.narration: "We were never interested in Tibet to begin with.@There's not much to be gained in attacking it.@I was told Tibet was a peace-loving country,@so we avoided killing people without cause."
"We, the Mongolian people,@were attacked without warning or just cause.@I'm sure it was you evil Rakshasis behind it.@You bewitched our people with@your strange sorcery."
"We must have our revenge…@by eliminating the threat posed by the Rakshasi.@And so we launched a full-scale campaign."

group_1.textRight: That's why we give priority to raiding nunneries.

group_1.textLeft: B-but… This type of invasion…

group_1.textRight: We are only attacking you because you@attacked us first.

group_1.textLeft: This is something more complicated@than I expected, yeah…

group_1.narration: "In any case, if we strike at that Rakshasi nest,@Tibet's martial strength will be vastly diminished.@No, not just that.@They will be entirely unable to resist our forces."
"And when that happens...the war will be over,@and peace will come with minimal losses."

group_1.textRight: But to contend with that nunnery,@we'll need something special...
…That's why we need your help.
How about we join forces and end this war@quickly?

group_1.textLeft: …I suppose…@[chara:103501:lipSynch_0][wait:1.5][chara:103501:cheek_0][chara:103501:face_mtn_ex_000.exp3.json][chara:103501:eyeClose_0][chara:103501:lipSynch_1]That would be for the best.

group_1.textRight: You're joining forces with them?!

group_1.textLeft: Of course not, but we need to gather intel@on the Mongolian side.

group_1.textRight: Thank goodness… I'm glad that was a lie.@[chara:103601:lipSynch_0][wait:1.5][chara:103601:cheek_0][chara:103601:face_mtn_ex_040.exp3.json][chara:103601:lipSynch_1]But what kind of info are we gathering?

group_1.textLeft: Rabi must be somewhere nearby.@And speaking of nearby...

group_1.textRight: That nunnery?

group_1.textLeft: Yes… That's why we need to learn when@the Mongols are going to attack.
We have to get Rabi out of there.

group_1.textRight: …Understood.@I'll help however I can!
I can't let you put yourself in danger all alone.

group_1.textLeft: Urara…!

group_1.textRight: …What was that?@You suddenly went silent.

group_1.textLeft: It's nothing…@We'll cooperate with you, don't worry.
We promise to help you.

group_1.textRight: Heh… Forced to betray your allies.@I can understand how you might be upset.
But this is all for the sake of peace…@Try not to think too much about it.

group_1.textLeft: Where are you going?

group_1.textRight: I have a whole army to lead.
I can't stay here with just you two.
He didn't seem like such a bad person.

group_1.textLeft: Yes… Neither side of the Tibet and Mongolian@war seems wholly good or evil after all…
I suppose the conflict simply came about due@to a difference of viewpoints.
Huh…? Wh-what is it?

group_1.textRight: Maybe they came to ambush us@once we had our guards down?!
No, that's not it.

group_1.textLeft: That voice…?

group_1.textRight: Thank goodness you're safe.

group_1.textLeft: Rabi!
And who's that with you?

group_1.textRight: Nice to meet you.@I am Heruka from the nunnery.

group_1.textLeft: Heruka…?
…I see, so there's a discrepancy@in the history…
In the end, how can we tell which parts@are right and wrong?

group_1.textRight: It's not that something is out of place,@but rather...

group_1.narration: "With elements like the Tibet-Mongolian war@being caused by Rakshasis, or nunneries serving@as Rakshasi training institutions..."
"The two histories differ in fundamental ways."

group_1.textRight: …We may have no choice but to intervene@at this point.
If we allow the Rakshasi to win the fight…
There's a good chance that we, as future beings,@will fade from existence.

group_1.textLeft: Is that a possibility?!

group_1.textRight: That's how warped this history is...
Um, have you all finished talking?
The changing of the guard has begun,@so it's time to go...

group_1.textLeft: I understand.

group_1.textRight: But...are you sure you guys don't want@to come with us?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, after hearing more about Mongolia's side@of things…
I figured that we should look into@this some more.

group_1.textRight: We'll keep an eye on things and help figure out@what's happening here.

group_1.textLeft: …But I'm sorry we'll have to leave you@by yourself…

group_1.textRight: Don't worry about that. And don't be too hard@on yourself either.

group_1.textLeft: Sure, and the same goes for you.

group_1.textRight: See you later, then.

group_1.textLeft: Of course!

group_1.textRight: They're gone.

group_1.textLeft: Yes… However.
We have to do what we can to help.
